com.salesforce.omakase.error

Class DefaultErrorManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesforce.omakase.error.DefaultErrorManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ErrorManager

    public class DefaultErrorManager
extends Object
implements ErrorManager
    The default Omakase ErrorManager.

      Constructor and Description
      DefaultErrorManager()
      Creates a new DefaultErrorManager instance with no given name.

      Creates a new DefaultErrorManager instance with the given name.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean autoSummarize()
      Should return true if ErrorManager.summarize() should automatically be called at the end of parsing if there are errors and the result wrapped and thrown by a new ProblemSummaryException.
      String getSourceName()
      Gets the name of the source currently being parsed.
      boolean hasErrors()
      Returns true if there were any errors.

      Reports an error message.

      Reports an error based on a ParserException.
      void report(SubscriptionException exception)
      Reports an uncaught exception from a subscription method.
      DefaultErrorManager rethrow(boolean rethrow)
      Specifies whether reported exceptions should be rethrown as encountered, instead of reported as another error message (default true).
      String summarize()
      Returns a summary of errors.
      DefaultErrorManager warnings(boolean showWarnings)
      Specifies whether to include warning messages in the summary (default true).

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultErrorManager

        public DefaultErrorManager()
        Creates a new DefaultErrorManager instance with no given name.

      • DefaultErrorManager

        public DefaultErrorManager(String sourceName)
        Creates a new DefaultErrorManager instance with the given name.

        The name is used to provide more meaningful information on what CSS file or resource caused the problem.

        Parameters:
        sourceName - Name of the CSS file, to be used for error reporting.

    • Method Detail

      • rethrow

        public DefaultErrorManager rethrow(boolean rethrow)
        Specifies whether reported exceptions should be rethrown as encountered, instead of reported as another error message (default true).
        Parameters:
        rethrow - Specify true to rethrow reported Exceptions.
        Returns:
        this, for chaining.

      • warnings

        public DefaultErrorManager warnings(boolean showWarnings)
        Specifies whether to include warning messages in the summary (default true).
        Parameters:
        showWarnings - Specify true to include warning messages.
        Returns:
        this, for chaining.

      • getSourceName

        public String getSourceName()
        Description copied from interface: ErrorManager
        Gets the name of the source currently being parsed. If not set this may return null.
        Specified by:
        getSourceName in interface ErrorManager
        Returns:
        The name of the source currently being parsed.

      • report

        public void report(ErrorLevel level,
                   Syntax cause,
                   String message)
        Description copied from interface: ErrorManager
        Reports an error message. This is usually called from Validate subscription methods.

        Implementations should not throw or rethrow an exception from this method.

        You can use ErrorUtils.format(Syntax, String) as a helper.

        Specified by:
        report in interface ErrorManager
        Parameters:
        level - The ErrorLevel.
        cause - The Syntax unit that is the cause of the error (e.g., the unit that has failed validation).
        message - The error message.

      • report

        public void report(ParserException exception)
        Description copied from interface: ErrorManager
        Reports an error based on a ParserException.

        These are usually thrown by core parsers or custom refiner plugins, which is usually caused by bad CSS source code input.

        Specified by:
        report in interface ErrorManager
        Parameters:
        exception - The exception that describes the error.

      • report

        public void report(SubscriptionException exception)
        Description copied from interface: ErrorManager
        Reports an uncaught exception from a subscription method.

        This will occur when a subscription plugin method throws an exception. This usually means there is a programming error in the plugin, e.g., an NPE. It also might mean the plugin throws an unrelated (to the parser) exception which will results in an InvocationTargetException (this should be avoided).

        Check the cause to find the underlying InvocationTargetException.

        Specified by:
        report in interface ErrorManager
        Parameters:
        exception - The exception.

      • hasErrors

        public boolean hasErrors()
        Description copied from interface: ErrorManager
        Returns true if there were any errors.
        Specified by:
        hasErrors in interface ErrorManager
        Returns:
        True of there were errors.

      • autoSummarize

        public boolean autoSummarize()
        Description copied from interface: ErrorManager
        Should return true if ErrorManager.summarize() should automatically be called at the end of parsing if there are errors and the result wrapped and thrown by a new ProblemSummaryException.
        Specified by:
        autoSummarize in interface ErrorManager
        Returns:
        True if #ErrorManager.summarize() should be called automatically.

      • summarize

        public String summarize()
        Description copied from interface: ErrorManager
        Returns a summary of errors.

        If there are no errors then this should return an empty string.

        Specified by:
        summarize in interface ErrorManager
        Returns:
        True if there were else, otherwise an empty string.
